channel.title: Comments on: Using Android as a media player

item.title: By: Brian O'Donovan
item.dc:creator: Brian O'Donovan
item.description: <p>I am an avid listener of Podcasts and I personally recommend the Google Listen application for podcatching on Android. My two favourite features are:</p><p>1- Your subscriptions are automatically reflected in Google Reader as a feed group called "Listen Subscriptions"<br/>2 - It will synchronise over the air in the background without any user interaction. You can configure it to only download media files when you are connected to Wifi so you don't "waste" your 3G data allowance.,</p>
item.content:encoded:
I am an avid listener of Podcasts and I personally recommend the Google Listen application for podcatching on Android. My two favourite features are:

1- Your subscriptions are automatically reflected in Google Reader as a feed group called "Listen Subscriptions"
2 – It will synchronise over the air in the background without any user interaction. You can configure it to only download media files when you are connected to Wifi so you don't "waste" your 3G data allowance.,

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Vitor,</p><p>Yes you'd still download on the Mac. Unfortunately the Winamp desktop software is Windows only so it involves using a virtual machine to use the wifi syncing, which is the reason I dont use it.</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Vitor,

Yes you'd still download on the Mac. Unfortunately the Winamp desktop software is Windows only so it involves using a virtual machine to use the wifi syncing, which is the reason I dont use it.

Matt

item.title: By: Vitor Pereira
item.dc:creator: Vitor Pereira
item.description: <p>Interesting. One of the reasons I went for an Android device was to be able to have the podcasts I listen to in the device without having to sync with a pc\mac. With winamp you still have to download on your mac and then sync to the device, is that it?</p>
item.content:encoded: Interesting. One of the reasons I went for an Android device was to be able to have the podcasts I listen to in the device without having to sync with a pc\mac. With winamp you still have to download on your mac and then sync to the device, is that it?
